content.description: Route follows easy features up the east face of "Lightning Rock", so named for Quartz veins running through the rock. Fun feet. One hold up top on the edge is slightly loose... beware of that one. Hit it with a big rock or your bong or issue of Rock and Ice or something.
content.location: Head west from Big Boulder up the talus covered hill. Lightning Rock is located at the top of the hill.

content.description: Heads up following the obvious major crack on the boulder. Easy moves up to just short of the top, with an interesting move or two and an easy mantle. Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection: Typical trad rack if you choose to protect it. Options for an anchor on top are not very good.
content.location: Big Boulder is the major boulder visible from Crystal Lake Road and the turnout described in this route's "Area" page. This route is on the face you see from the road.

content.description:
Route follows crack to top. Starts off as very easy offwidth down low (easy full body jam), then turns into hands to fingers to slopey mantle. An easy move after the mantle and you're on top. Watch for loose rocks up here.

This route is a fine C1 aid pitch for training.

Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection:
Gear to 3"

50m rope

LONG webbing for slung block at top of north face... I'd say +/-20ft of webbing.
content.location: This route is located on the east face of Big Boulder, which is easy to see from the parking turnout.

content.description: TK421 and Carbonite are the author's two favorite lines on this face. The route starts up easy but fun moves onto a face where long reach comes in handy. Some spicy moderate moves takes you to the tip of the spear. Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection: Bouldering. No pro up top unless someone bolts it. If you chose to protect the climb, you could place gear in the crack. A typical trad rack will suffice. There's really nowhere for a decent anchor on top.
content.location: Big Boulder is the major boulder visible from Crystal Lake Road and the turnout described in this route's "Area" page. This route is on the face you see from the road.

content.description: Climb the thin seam to the right of Trench Run. Protect it via Trench Run or bring tiny stuff or whatever.
content.protection:
Tiny nuts and a single set of cams to 2"

Bring 30ft+ of webbing and a bolt hanger for the anchor on top.

content.description: Thin feet up a lichen covered face to a solid edge up top. Traverse left down the easy edge for a quicker 'walkoff'.
content.location: This route is on the west face of Bonsai Boulder, hidden in the trees west of Big Boulder.

content.description: This line climbs the face to the left of Big Boulder's right edge. Fun easy moves with some exposure. Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection: Bouldering. No pro up top unless someone bolts it.
content.location: Big Boulder is the major boulder visible from Crystal Lake Road and the turnout described in this route's "Area" page. This route is on the face you see from the road.

content.description: Thin moves up the right side of the face. This is the best route on the face. Walkoff to the southeast on the lowest side of the boulder.
content.location: This route is located on the right side of Bonsai Boulder's west face.

content.description: This line goes up the right edge of the southwest face of Big Boulder. Easy climbing starting atop loose blocks then moving onto solid face with a couple interesting moves just shy of the top. Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection: Bouldering. No pro up top unless someone bolts it.
content.location: Big Boulder is the major boulder visible from Crystal Lake Road and the turnout described in this route's "Area" page. This route is on the face you see from the road.

content.description: This route follows good holds up and right on the center of the west face of Bonsai Boulder. Easy fun topout. Walkoff to the southeast on the lowest side of the boulder.
content.protection: A pad, though I never felt the need for one.
content.location: This route is on the west face of Bonsai Boulder, hidden in the trees west of Big Boulder.

content.description: Starts up a couple cool moves, then goes up on fun easy moves that thin out near the top. Slightly spicy at the end. Nice exposure. Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection: Bouldering. No pro up top unless someone bolts it.
content.location: Big Boulder is the major boulder visible from Crystal Lake Road and the turnout described in this route's "Area" page. This route is on the face you see from the road.

content.description: This and TK421 are the author's favorite routes on the SW face of Big Boulder. The route starts up following a thin finger crack with easy footholds in the middle, and a spicy finish. Good fun climbing. Walkoff/downclimb via the north side.
content.protection: Bouldering. No pro up top unless someone bolts it.
content.location: Big Boulder is the major boulder visible from Crystal Lake Road and the turnout described in this route's "Area" page. This route is on the face you see from the road.

content.description: Start hold is on the right side of the small roof and 8 inches to the right of a vertical white stripe in the rock. Traverse left using sidepulls and the slopey top edge of the boulder. Once past the roof, go straight up and top out on the peak of the boulder.
content.protection: 1-3 pads, depending on your comfort level
content.location: Located about 150 feet (measured in google maps) due west of the large main boulder, next to a patch of trees providing nice shade. The route is on the south side of what may be Bonsai Boulder. Around the corner to the left there is a sharp arete and the west side of the boulder is a slab face.

content.description: Lumberjack Rock, so named because of the dead wood everywhere around it. This line heads straight up the obvious easy features. Very easy for those with long reach.
content.location: Lumberjack Rock is a hundred meters or so west of Big Boulder, up the hill and to the left near some trees. Easy to spot with the copious amounts of dead wood at its base, and the small cave underneath the rock.
